full_text: Eine he Blink 2017/KER/49283 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS WEDNESDAY, THE 6TH DAY OF DECEMBER 2017/15TH AGRAHAYANA, 1939 Cril.MC.No. 4681 of 2017 () CRIME NO. 1352/2013 OF KADAKKAL POLICE STATION , KOLLAM PETITIONER (S) /DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: VANAJA RADHAKRISHNAN, D/O.THANKARAJ, AGED 35, MANGALATH VEEDU, VARAYADI, VAYYANAM, ITTIVA VILLAGE, KOTTARAKKARA TALUK, KOLLAM DISTRICT BY ADVS.SRI.S.R.SREEJITH SRI .U.NAZEER RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT : 1. THE STATE OF KERALA, THROUGH THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, KADAKKAL POLICE STATION, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2. HARIDAS,S/O VASUDEVAN PILLAI VISHNU BHAVAN, VARAYADI, VAYYANAM, ITTIVA VILLAGE, KOLLAM-691533 R2 BY ADV. SRI.LIJU. M.P R BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR:SRI C PRASAD THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Elna ee Pls} 2017/KER/49283 Crl.MC.No. 4681 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED OF PETITION FILED BY THE PETITIONER BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, KADAKKAL (TEMPORARY) AS C.M.P.NO.620/2017 ANNEXURE A2 CERTIFIED COPY OF THE ORDER DATED 29.04.2017 PASSED BY THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, KADAKKAL (TEMPORARY) IN C.M.P.NO.620/2017 IN C.C.1930/2015 RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS:NIL True Copy / P A to Judge Bln 2017/KER/49283 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No.4681 of 2017 Dated this the 6" day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioner herein, aggrieved by the dismissal of her application under section 302 Cr.P.C has approached this Court. Petitioner herein is the de facto complainant in C.C.No.1930 of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kadakkal (Temporary). It appears that, there was a counter case as C.C.No.9 of 2014, in which, CW1 was the de facto complainant. In that case, Annexure-Al application under section 302Cr.P.C was laid on a premise that since CW1 in C.C.No.9 of 2014 was the accused in C.C.No.1930 of 2015 and if it is conducted by the same Assistant Public Prosecutor, there is likelihood of prejudice. 2. Court below, after hearing the petitioner herein and the learned Assistant Public Prosecutor dismissed the application after perusing the files. It was found by the learned magistrate that, Assistant Public Prosecutor of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Punalur was to conduct the prosecution in C.C.No.9 of 2014. Other connected case was conducted by another Public Prosecutor. Court below rightly concluded that, since the case and counter case are handed by different Public Prosecutors, no prejudice will be caused to the victim in the case and there is no likelihood of Bee E] ry 2017/KER/49283 Cril.M.C.4681/17 2 miscarriage of justice. Evidently, the apprehension of the petitioner herein stand allayed by the very fact that two separate Assistant Public Prosecutors are conducting the cases. Having considered this, I find no ground for challenge in the case. Crl.M.C fails and is dismissed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge Sbna/6/12/17 True Copy / P A to Judge
